revised_title: Thermal Conductivity of Germanium and Silicon: The Impact of Impurities
tldr: The authors measured the thermal conductivity of germanium and silicon single crystals with varying amounts of impurities. They found that the addition of impurities significantly decreases the thermal conductivity and alters its temperature dependence. The results are in fair agreement with the theory of impurity scattering by electrons or holes in the impurity energy levels. This study provides insights into the behavior of thermal conduction in these materials and the impact of impurities on their properties.
